page.description: Evaluate an expression in the context of an object.

item.name: Browses (for <OBJECT> use either the <BROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for <OBJECT> use either the <FORM> pointer or the name of the form)
Form Controls (for <OBJECT> use the <CONTROL> pointer or the address of the control)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.EVAL() method evaluates an expression in the context of an object. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example retrieves the value of the Firstname field by combining the name of the field with ".value". This illustrates how you can access a field's value by using its name, rather than a field pointer.
section.example: dim frm as P dim lst as C dim fld as C frm = form.view("Customer Information") lst = frm.child_enum() fld = word(lst,15,crlf()) ? eval(fld +".value") = "Michael
